chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • John P Sporer was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 2 days sentence credit.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes:
Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week. 
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel meeting on either 2-18-2015 or the following meeting.  Defendant to serve 30 days jail, consecutive as penalty for non attendance at a Victim Impact Panel meeting

Cash bail of $400 to be applied to fine.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.  Balance of fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Village of Hartland Police Department.  To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

06/05/15 PER REVIEW HEARING, COURT RE-ISSUES THE 180 DAYS CONDITION TIME. SENTENCE CREDIT OF 150 DAYS WERE GRANTED. 
DEFENDANT TO REPORT ON 06/13/2015 TO COMPLETE THE REMAINING 30 DAYS. NON-WORKING HOURS, RELEASE FOR STANDARD CONDITIONS. TOTAL CREDIT OF 150 DAYS WERE GRANTED.

Defendant John P Sporer in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at the Court's request for resentencing.  Parties stipulate that Condition time should have been 180 days on the original judgment.  Defendant has already served the 150 days that were originally ordered.  Court orders Defendant to report to Huber to serve the remaining 30 days of Condition time on June 13, 2015.  Condition time in Judgment of Conviction to be amended to:  CONDITION TIME: 180 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  Credit for 150 days.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant John P Sporer in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read in.  Count 4 dismissed by operation of law.  Case 14CT990 dismissed and read in to this matter.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 6 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years) STAYED.  Credit for 2 days if revoked.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on any vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant 
- Alcohol Assessment
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on either February 18, 2015 or the following one, or 30 days jail consecutive.
- $400.00 of cash bail to be applied to fine.  Any remaining cash bail to be refunded to poster.  
- Fine of $2,658.00; $400.00 from cash bail to be applied to fine.  Any remaining fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Hartland Police Department
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Continue with AODA treatment.   Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week. Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  
CONDITION TIME: 150 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence FORTHWITH.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 29, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant John P Sporer in court with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests time for defendant to look into ATC.  Court addresses WCS letter.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on December 19, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.   Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.   Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.
